resources.string: Google Quiz
1. What is the origin of the word \'Google\'?
Transposition of to \'ogle goo\'
\'Googol\', the number 1 with 100 zeros
\'Goolies\', a synonym for testicles
The name of the parrot of Sergey Brin, the co-founder of Google
2. Who was the most Googled person of 2017?
Stephen Bannon
Harvey Weinstein
Matt Lauer
Kevin Spacey
3. Google owns a numerical .com domain that redirects to its homepage and which is related to the number you will get on a phone with an alphanumeric keypad when you type GOOGLE. What is the number?
5. Who is \'Stan\' at Google\'s headquarters Googleplex?
4. What is the motto of Google\'s corporate code of conduct?
6. Which facts about Google are true?
7. How many searches are processed by Google every second on average?
8. What facts about Google are wrong?
9. On August 16, 2013, Google went down for 5 minutes. How many percent dropped the global Internet traffic in that time?
10. Which language has Google a version of their site translated into?
QuizAppHeaderImage
Let\'s make the world a better place
Don\'t dream it be it
Don’t be afraid - just believe
Don\'t be evil
A statue of Google\'s co-founder Stan Page.
The housekeeper Stanley Spadowski, who had the idea for developing Google Maps.
Nickname of a T-Rex skeleton on the Google campus.
A dog living on the campus that greets all coming employees at the main entrance every morning.
Google hired a camel to create the Street View of a desert.
You can see underwater sea life, coral reefs and wrecks using Google Maps.
Google prefers cats to dogs. Their official code of conduct specifically states they are a cat company.
Google earns US$20 billion a year from advertising, more than the primetime revenues of CBS, NBC, ABC, and FOX combined.
40 to 45% of queries that get asked every day have never been asked before
There is a mirrored website of Google Search with horizontally flipped search results,
Google was originally called \'RubBack\'.
When a Google employee dies, their spouses receive half pay from the company for 10 years and their children US$1,000 per month until they turn 19.
The Klingon language, spoken by the Klingons in Star Trek.
The Dothraki language spoken by the Dothraki in Games of Thrones.
Elvish, created by J.R.R. Tolkien and spoken by the tribe of Elves.
The Naʼvi language spoken by the Naʼvi in Avatar.
